channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I’m an idiot’: I’m middle aged, earn $68,000 a year and have $39,000 in credit-card debt
item.description: “I plan on keeping the accounts open to protect my credit, but I will cut and toss all the cards so I can’t use them.”

item.title: Inside the story that enraged OpenAI

item.title: Here’s the most unappreciated AI beneficiary right now, according to Ark Invest’s Cathie Wood
item.description: “I do believe the U.S. was at risk of losing innovation” before Trump entered the White House, Wood said.

item.title: Foxconn builds AI factory in partnership with Taiwan and Nvidia
item.description: Nvidia and Foxconn announced they are working with the Taiwan government to build an AI factory supercomputer.

item.title: AI strategies from the front lines
item.description: AI’s potential to transform business is undeniable, but realizing tangible value remains a challenge. This session explores where AI is driving the gr...

item.title: The real impact of AI on your organization
item.description: AI technologies are reshaping work, but not all workflows or roles will be equally transformed. Discover how AI is changing the way we work, given the...

item.title: NVIDIA releases cloud-to-robot computing platforms for physical AI, humanoid development

item.title: Samsung boosts OLED TV gaming with Nvidia G-Sync compatibility
item.description: Samsung said its 2025 OLED TV lineup will feature Nvidia G-Sync compatibility, delivering smooth gameplay, low latency, and more.

item.title: My father’s widow keeps sending me $200 checks in the mail. Why would she do this?
item.description: “I sent a ‘thank you’ card and asked what it was for, but I got no answer.”

item.title: Nvidia launches AI-first DGX Personal Computing Systems
item.description: Nvidia announced that Taiwan’s leading system manufacturers are set to build Nvidia DGX Spark and DGX Station systems.

item.title: Quantum Machines launches Qualibrate open source framework to speed quantum computer calibration
item.description: Quantum Machines, a provider of advanced hybrid quantum-classical control solutions, announced today the release of Qualibrate.

item.title: Can crowdsourced fact-checking curb misinformation on social media?

item.title: I’m 72 and my wife is 57. We have $4.5 million in assets. Should she retire sooner — or should I go back to work?
item.description: With millions of dollars in assets, the decision comes down to lifestyle in or out of retirement.

item.title: He called the S&P 500 bottom. Now this stock trader can’t rule out a ‘flash crash.’
item.description: Theo Trade’s Jeff Bierman: “You have to be very careful how you approach this market.”
